Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia University is not for the faint-hearted. It is incredibly trying and it is easy to get lost in the flood of excellence. The people are what make it: your friends, the professors and TAs you create bonds with. I took both Economics and Visual Arts classes. The Economics classes were competitive and large, the professors impersonal. I absolutely loved my Visual Arts classes however. All my professors were talented, friendly, passionate professionals actively working in their fields. The art school facilities were wonderful too. The administration is were a lot of Columbia's problems stem from, but on an individual level, once you find your footing, you'll have a great time.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia University is a prestigious institution known for its academic excellence and diverse student body. It offers a wealth of opportunities in both social and academic spheres, making it an attractive choice for students seeking a rigorous education in a vibrant urban setting. However, the high cost of tuition and living expenses can be a significant drawback. Additionally, some students find professors less accessible, and safety on campus remains a concern. Despite these challenges, Columbia provides unparalleled resources and networking opportunities for those who can navigate its demanding environment.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: SO. MUCH. FUN. Amazing professors, fanastic student groups, hilarious friends. Admin does not represent what students stand for. Gorg campus and amazing to be in the city.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The university administration is highly disappointing. The campus is essentially off-limits to both students and alumni, which is frustrating considering the high tuition fees. It’s disappointing that those who pay for their education and have been part of the community are denied access to the campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The professors are elite, something a student should definitely take advantage of. Classes can be difficult, but doable. The location is also great; separated from the downtown nightlife scenes, but with enough culture and nature around to enjoy both.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The best part was the growth you inevitably experience through living in New York City while juggling insanely rigorous courses. I wish there was less of an individualistic and competitive attitude. You have to figure everything out by yourself here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia University has been an incredible experience overall. The professors are very understanding and approachable, which makes even the most challenging courses enjoyable and engaging. The academics are rigorous but fun, pushing you to think critically and explore new ideas. While the food on campus leaves something to be desired, the vibrant campus life more than makes up for it. There’s always something happening, from student events to club activities, ensuring you’re never bored. And if you’re into the party scene, Columbia truly shines—it’s one of the best aspects of the social experience here. It’s a dynamic environment that balances hard work with plenty of opportunities for fun and connection.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Columbia! The dining halls, communal learning centers, libraries, and other campus spaces are all newly renovated. Furthermore, attending school in one of the world's most global and comprehensive cities unlocks inumerable academic, internship, and social opportunities.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia University is a great school to take advantage of learning from some of the leading minds in every discipline; however, the amount of support you receive depends on the professors. Moreover, departmental and administrative politics tends to limit the amount of support undergraduate students receive from their major department and/or the college as a whole. Overall, I would recommend that you find the enclaves that you feel supported and can engage with the subjects that interest you the most.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: sqlkdlq ksdjql kjdljsldkqj lskdjlq ksdjl qksjdlkqsjdl kqjsdlk qsjddlk lqskjdl kqjsd j qsmld lksdjla ksjdlqkjds lks
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: A large part of my experience at Columbia was restricted by COVID guidelines, including Zoom classes and masking requirements into 2022. I loved my freshman year and most of my senior year, which felt packed with activities and opportunities. While I had many renowned professors, I struggled to find ways to connect with them since our class sizes were often large.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia University is the GOAT in the nation. Especially, career opportunities / alumni networking on top of the best academic resources, because of the location. Many alumni work in NYC and help students for internships or full-time careers and visit the campus often.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
As a graduate student at Columbia University's School of Professional Studies majoring in Strategic Communications, my overall experience has been enriching and insightful. The classes are well-structured, interesting, and highly applicable to real-world business scenarios. The curriculum is thoughtfully designed, strongly emphasizing developing strategic thinking and effective communication skills that are directly transferable to the workplace.

That said, I feel there is room for improvement in fostering a stronger sense of community outside the classroom. More engagement activities like networking events, workshops, or casual mingling opportunities would greatly enhance the overall experience. Such initiatives could provide students with a chance to build meaningful connections across different programs and broaden their professional networks.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Average academic level and mixed level of professors. Environment is toxic in past year. I will not recommend applying to Colombia right now
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia was the best decision I ever made. It is an elite institution at the top of the education system. These Niche rankings are so much better and more objective than U.S. News. This school is world renowned for its positive impact on students lives, and her alumni do great things and lead the world in a positive direction. Thank you, Columbia!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia is one of the most significant U.S. institutions for higher learning. Niche rankings are by far the most accurate and objective, while USNews college rankings are laughable in comparison. Columbia's national and worldwide reputation is rivaled by very, very few. With top-tier academics and unlimited potential for student success, this school has long shown itself to be a beacon of academic perfection.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
The resources available at Columbia are unparalleled. The Butler Library, with its vast collection of historical documents and rare manuscripts, became my second home. I spent countless hours there, poring over primary sources and conducting research for my papers. The opportunity to access such a wealth of information has been invaluable to my academic growth.
Living in New York City has been an adventure in itself. The city’s cultural diversity and endless opportunities for exploration have made my time at Columbia even more exciting. From visiting world-class museums like the Metropolitan Museum of Art to enjoying Broadway shows and exploring different neighborhoods, there’s always something to do.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia is an interesting school to be at.  If you like the city, I think it's great.  If not, it can be quite overwhelming at times to study among the constant hustle and bustle of the city.  The people are amazing and interesting.  The administration can be a little cold.  Overall, a good choice for someone independent.  They do NOT hold your hand here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
As a visiting student at Columbia University, I had an incredible experience that broadened my academic and personal horizons. The history department is truly exceptional, featuring a diverse range of courses that cover various periods and themes. The professors are not only knowledgeable but also passionate about their subjects, creating an engaging an encouraging learning environment.

I particularly enjoyed the opportunity to explore unique historical perspectives through a variety of electives. The access to extensive resources, including the incredible libraries and archives, greatly enriched my research and projects.
Columbia's location in New York City provided countless opportunities to visit historical sites, museums, and cultural events, making my learning experience even more dynamic.
Overall, my time at Columbia was transformative, and I left with not only a deeper understanding of history but also valuable friendships and memories that I will cherish for years to come.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: The school has great academics and passionate/goal-drive student body. The campus, libraries, and facilities are also great.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia truly is a place unlike any other. From the moment you step on campus, you know you're in a special place. With its grand-scale architecture and picturesque green quad, the campus inspires character and quality in its students before even stepping inside a classroom. Columbia then offers her students a college education and experience like no other. Being among the most talented students in the world and following in the footsteps of some of America's greatest minds has inspired me to work harder to pursue my full potential.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Campus life is great with the people around you however the schoolmdoesn't do much for.its students. Many resources however classes have many professors that aren't great and class styles are not the best for people who need hands on learning.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is definitely an experience really learned a lot here about myself college transition was definitely a time fo rme
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia offers a lot of diversity, from its student body to the student activities. I like that Columbia is in Manhattan, as I am able to enjoy going out with my friends and taking advantage of all that NYC offers.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia so far has exceeded my expectations! Though academically challenging, there is such a strong and positive community here. Everyone has a place.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Food 8.5/10
Academics 10/10
Parties 8.5/10
Professors 10/10
Extracurriculars 9.5/10
Location 10/10
Safety 9/10
Athletics 6.5/10
Dorms 8.5/10
Services 9/10
School Colors 10/10

Pros:
-Location: NYC
-Core Curriculum/liberal arts
-Ivy League: alumni network
-*Meets 100% of demonstrated need (cost mostly worth it for low income/top 1% students)
-Study abroad opportunities
-Air conditioning in undergrad dorms (iykyk) 
-Over 200 research centers and $1 billion+ dedicated to research opportunities
-Has a campus (some NYC colleges don’t)
-Mascot is a LION
-Great food

Cons:
-Location: NYC (noise & weather not ideal)
-High cost of attendance ESPECIALLY for upper/middle class (currently the most expensive tuition at~$95k/yr)
-Core Curriculum
-Ivy League: stress culture, nepotism, elitism
-Safety concerns (like any big city, but Columbia still has one of the safest campuses in the state)
-Finding housing off campus is challenging
-Vegan options limited on campus
-Limited campus space
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: This place was heaven at first. That is, until we all got kicked out of the dorms. It was such a great time, again, until graduating, after which I realized that the career center spouting CU alumni salaries of $80,000+ was all lies. I cannot even support myself
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I believe that anyone can feel welcomed within the columbia gates. Columbia's community is very diverse and vibrant, no one person is like the other however I believe this characteristic enables growth in our students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia is an immersive New York experience with an ideal monumental campus rooted in tradition. The stoic architecture stands adamantly among the Morningside Heights neighborhood of upper Manhattan—the ideal spot for a traditional Ivy League university to stand in excellence.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia University is a great opportunity for those whom are accepted. As a fourth year student, I can say with little doubt that the best part about this place is the students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Studenty body population is the best thing about the university. However after freshman year a clear lack of care and regard from admin is crystal clear.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia University is a place that offers students opportunities to grow, to experience, and to adore the beauty of science. I think that becoming a student at Columbia has been the best choice I had to make in my life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great university with excellent professors and choices for classes. Students are collaborative, smart and friendly. The campus food was outstanding from Organic food to junk food to food past midnight. Very beautiful Campus and libraries specially Barnard library. The academic experience was the one of the greatest so far with emphasis on studies and also students wellbeing. Not to mention that you will be in New York, one of the most beautiful city in the world.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: This past year at Columbia was really difficult. The campus climate was tough to survive at the end of the year, but ultimately, I had a good time. I enjoyed the academics, which challenged me, and I had a lot of fun opportunities to grow with social activities.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Although I have not yet been able to live in Columbia, as I am about to start this August, my visiting experience has been incredible. From What I have seen, dorms, classrooms, and dining halls seem pretty good. Also, the students on campus are super friendly and kind. Nevertheless, I wished for better management from the administration in times of turmoil and that the school's sports life was more advocated.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia is definitely special place to be and an alluring atmosphere to many. The education you receive and the knowledge you receive from the professors there is no joke. Oftentimes it seems as if school life is moving at 2x speed just because there’s always so much going on both academicly and socially. The only major criticism that comes to mind is our lack of school spirit. There seems be a lack of school pride when it comes to supporting sports teams, rallies, school events, etc. I would hope that the student body work towards supporting their fellow students and uplifting their community.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
As a biochemistry student at Columbia University, my experience was extraordinary. The Core Curriculum was a highlight, exposing me to literature, philosophy, art history, and music. This interdisciplinary approach enriched my understanding and fostered critical thinking and analytical writing skills.

Beyond academics, I loved engaging with the community through Peer Health Exchange (now S-HEAL), where I educated high school students on health and wellness. This experience enhanced my communication skills and deepened my commitment to public health.

Writing for The Spectator allowed me to make scientific concepts accessible, improving my ability to articulate ideas clearly. Additionally, Columbia’s vibrant arts scene, from Miller Theatre performances to Wallach Art Gallery exhibitions, provided a rich cultural balance to my studies.

Overall, Columbia offered a holistic education, blending rigorous science, arts, and community involvement, preparing me well for the future.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The beginning of freshman year was difficult for me. I had to make new friends, attend classes without support and figure out how to study while making time for my part time work and other extracurricular activities. However, by the middle of second semester, I started figuring out what is good for me in terms of the people I want in my life and how to study better to enhance my gpa. It was a tough year specially with the protests and violence in Columbia University. I had a lot to learn from the professors and students which helped me figure out who I really am and what my values are. I would say it was a fruitful year.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia challenged me academically and fostered immense growth. Stellar professors and classmates broadened my worldview, preparing me for my career. However, social life can be tough, with wealth-driven cliques. Despite the drawbacks, I'm incredibly grateful for the transformative experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience at Columbia University has been incredibly enriching. The academic rigor challenged me to grow intellectually, while the diverse community fostered invaluable connections and perspectives. From renowned professors to passionate peers, every interaction contributed to my personal and academic development. The campus culture encouraged exploration, creativity, and innovation, allowing me to pursue my interests and discover new passions. Whether in the classroom, research lab, or extracurricular activities, Columbia provided endless opportunities for learning and growth. Overall, my time at Columbia has been transformative, shaping me into a well-rounded individual prepared for future endeavors.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Very excited about it! The teachers are very nice and the administrative staff as well. I haven't started the program yet.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a senior, who - like many students here took out tons of money to pay for what I thought was a stellar education, something doesn't seem right. First off, they need to control the current on-campus protests. I understand the position, but it's disrupting class. So much so, that the job I have lined up is telling me that I might have to take additional classes so I am prepared. You will have to make boatloads of money to pay the loans of - no one ever talks about that. Many of my friends are going off to law or medical school but they also seem to wish they had saved up their money for law or medical school. I grew up in Brooklyn and there's no place I'd rather be than NYC but it's changed so much in the past year. It's going through a rough patch. I realize the city always comes back but something to consider. My twin sister is happy at Syracuse and received practically a full ride and is going to medical school next year. I am wondering about my experience here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Disgrace to the previously good name of Ivy League universities. Shame on the staff and administrators for allowing it to descend into a living nightmare
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: Worst university if i go back in time i would never study here, first off you pay a tution that is much higher than other universities please consider other universities trust me on this
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: This school, once the pride of New York has descended into disgrace.  It is not even a Top-50 school at this point as virtual signaling has replaced academic learning leaving the graduating students poor and ill-prepared upon graduation
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: It has been great! Being in NYC is a very special aspect of college life here, but Columbia also feels very separate from the city so you don't get distracted. The party scene for me is dull, I barely find parties to go to (or people to go with) but I'm sure Greek life is having fun. The people are so diverse and brilliant and the academics have me more immersed than I have ever been. It has been tough to adjust but I think that's something we need to go through to grow.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am disgusted with Columbia University.  The entire staff is showing, they are indoctrinated,  left-wing, libral,  democratic, idiots.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The university is great academically, but some professors have very large egos that get in the way of their ability to teach. It would be great if the campus were more diverse.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a sophomore at Columbia University, I've found it to be a thrilling academic journey. The campus in New York City pulses with energy, offering rigorous classes led by expert faculty. Beyond academics, there's a wealth of extracurricular activities and a tight-knit community. Columbia's emphasis on holistic development ensures students are well-prepared for future endeavors. In short, it's been a transformative experience, inspiring me to push boundaries and make a difference.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am an international student, and Columbia University is incredibly diverse and inclusive, much like the city of New York itself. However, the downsides are also very apparent. The cost of living in this city is high. My master's program does not offer any scholarships. Housing options at the university seem limited. Faced with steep tuition fees, I wonder if the courses are worth it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia University is an interesting mix of school and culture. While the academics are strong, I find the rest of the school experience to be lacking.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia is my favorite place ever. I was sad to leave but thankfully I kept my friends from uni. You will make great friends here (and at college in general) and you will learn a lot about yourself and others from the diverse student body and greater campus of New York City. If you feel that you could fit in here, I highly recommend Columbia. 10/10 food, dorms, and professors. The things I like least include the Core (hit or miss for most people) and the competitiveness of students. Let’s just be kind to each other and realize that we’re all going through something alright? Anyways, I was told by everyone in my family not to go here because NY is “so unsafe” but in my 4 yr. experience the campus has been safer than a year in my small hometown frfr.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The campus is beautiful and the curriculum is challenging. However, the undergraduate professors do not care very much for undergraduate students, and you have to really advocate for yourself frequently. The deans are very helpful in getting professors in motion, so I recommend getting to know your deans and academic advisors. If your schedule allows you to go to office hours, do it!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The experience in Columbia University for an international student is a unique journey marked by both excitement and challenges. It has brought me many opportunities for personal growth, cultural immersion, and academic exploration. It involves adapting to a new culture, making friends from diverse backgrounds, and gaining a global perspective.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia University,  is and always has been a signal of scholastic greatness, settled inside the most beautiful New York City. Columbia is known for its prestigious scholastics and amazing and recognized workforce, Columbia offers a rich embroidery of learning potential open doors across different disciplines. The grounds hums with scholarly interest, cultivating a climate where understudies flourish and thoughts thrive. Past the homeroom, the unique understudy life improves the university experience, with heap clubs, far-reaching developments, and extracurricular exercises to participate in. Whether investigating the notable design of Morningside Levels or digging into the city's social blend, Columbia College offers an unmatched excursion of revelation and development..
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience at Columbia University has been profoundly enriching. The academic rigor and distinguished faculty have fostered my intellectual growth, while the diverse community has broadened my perspectives. I've found ample opportunities for personal and professional development, and I'm grateful for the skills and connections gained during my time there.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: While at Columbia University, I enjoyed the vibrant intellectual atmosphere and engaging discussions with peers. The diverse range of extracurricular activities enhanced my overall experience. However, I'd suggest refining the advising system for more personalized guidance.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Columbia, the professors and the faculty is supportive and responsive. Thanks to the folks at general studies I was able to stay in school despite my financial struggles.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia definitely sets me up to succeed, especially since I am low income and first gen. They know how hard this transition could be for me and others like me so they are gentle but still strict so I can stay motivated. I met my forever friends here and the food isn't bad at all!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: As an international student, the experience of starting school in a new country can be challenging and uncertain. However, choosing to attend Columbia's graduate school of architecture, planning, and preservation exceeded my expectations. My main motivation for pursuing a graduate degree was to develop a different way of thinking. I wanted to broaden my worldview through new interactions. Columbia GSAPP offers exactly that. The program emphasizes swift movement from thought to action and offers opportunities for broadening one's worldview through new interactions. They bring in relevant and contemporary speakers to further push the discourse on design and its abilities. The studios are equipped with the faculty at the top of their field.  Minor improvements could be made in the organization of classes and the distribution of scholarships and assistantships. Overall, I would highly recommend the experience to anyone pursuing their masters in architecture.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia offers a multifaceted perspective to college life, as it includes the prospect of living in New York City, the opportunity to study with award-winning professors, the internships it has, and many more aspects. Studying here has also allowed me to understand our society through a greater lens and hone in to fight and advocate regarding the social issues we face.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I liked that the courses challenged me, and that the new student orientation program facilitated a solid start to the school year. The campus is really beautiful, and the dining is as good as a college student could ask for. There's also a lot of resources that allow you to try to really be a scholar. The culture and pressures of college though are very prevalent there, and it can be difficult to find real connections while it's easy to get caught up in something as frustrating as academics.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: High quality education. The professors are the best in their field, and genuinely care about students and how they'll be shaping the future. The material is challenging, the class discussions are intellectually stimulating, and my perspective on the world has developed significantly in the year and a half I've attended.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The professors are very helpful and the curriculum seems to be extensive. I would like to see a better gym, as the gym lacks the amount of space and equipment.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Columbia University. I am a transfer student and it has been an incredible opportunity. I would recommend it to anyone.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The education is really world-class. High quality professors and a reasonable workload. However, as an international student I've found that the university lacks early responsiveness to student immigration status and funding requests. Additionally, my experience with student academic advising has not been great -- the advisor will regurgitate information that's available on Columbia's comprehensive websites, but is unable to assist with academic requests oftentimes. What I like about the administration is how it's been handling demonstrations on campus in light of recent events. Despite the outcry coming from students who claim the school's safety policies favor a particular group, I believe Columbia has taken responsible action to ensure safety on campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have greatly enjoyed my time at Columbia University, as it provides a mostly safe and welcoming campus atmosphere in the heart of NYC. I enjoy the small size of the campus and how close it is to the many activities NYC has to offer. The campus community is also relatively kind and close-knit. I have enjoyed the academic rigor of the classes and the caliber of the professors as well. Unfortunately classes in the arts are relatively inaccessible and have extra expenses that aren't included in an already high tuition, which has made my time as an arts student stressful.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I don’t get enough financial aid, it’s hard to get jobs on campus. I’m constantly worried about tuition costs. I am depressed. I love the education and environment though. It’s just not for poor international students like myself.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: It was a lot to be a FLI student. I felt like there was not a lot of help from professors to really teach the materials unless you learn them on your own. I worked and studied full time so learning outside of classroom wasnt really an option for me
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia is all about New York. Sometimes it feels like the whole city can be your campus. Between the food, cultural activities, sports, and general NYC community my college experience was greatly enhanced. That's not to say there's nothing on campus. Columbia has a real campus in the heart of the city that feels separate, and through which a real college community is built.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: One of the standout aspects of Columbia University's graduate schools is the exceptional faculty. The professors are not only experts in their fields but also passionate about teaching and mentoring students. Their dedication to our academic growth is evident in their engaging lectures, insightful discussions, and willingness to support our learning journey.  Columbia University's graduate schools also provide an array of resources and opportunities for personal and professional development. The university's extensive library system, research facilities, and cutting-edge technology have been instrumental in facilitating my research and academic pursuits. Additionally, the career services and networking events offered by the university have helped me connect with industry professionals and explore various career paths. The combination of outstanding faculty, abundant resources, and the vibrant city of New York has provided me with an unparalleled educational experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Studying at Columbia University's Irvin Medical Center Campus (CUIMC) as a MPH graduate student has been truly transformative. The dynamic atmosphere, exceptional professors, and diverse community have made it an outstanding journey.

CU's environment buzzes with energy and innovation. It's not just an academic institution; it's a hub of real-world healthcare challenges. The professors at CU MSPH are dedicated mentors and experts in their fields. Their commitment to students' success is evident in every lecture and interaction, imparting invaluable knowledge.

The global perspective at CU is enriching. Interacting with diverse peers broadens horizons and enhances understanding of public health issues. The supportive community, from advisors to fellow students, fosters a sense of belonging.

In conclusion, my time at CUMC has been extraordinary. It's an environment where knowledge is applied for positive change, empowering future public health leaders.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: The experience in Columbia University for an international student is a unique journey marked by both excitement and challenges. It has brought me many opportunities for personal growth, cultural immersion, and academic exploration. It involves adapting to a new culture, making friends from diverse backgrounds, and gaining a global perspective. I have faced some challenges of homesickness, language barriers, and adjusting to different educational systems, but Columbia provides helpful support from fellow students and university resources. In conclusion, it is a rewarding adventure to help me broaden horizons, foster independence, and prepare for a globalized world.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: good university, with good students and professors , thank all them , it was good memory in mind, i hope so anothers
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Academics were rigorous, especially writing demand. It was useful to me later in life. Otherwise, I was present during several racial incidents. I often felt out of place among the student population though I was intellectually able to keep up. The campus itself seems like a gated community that distinguishes itself from the surrounding Harlem neighborhood, which was consistent with the air of arrogance and elitism at the university.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: i did a precollege program at columbia university. it was great being a commuter and meeting new friends and building connections that have such a large impact on me today. i would definitely reccomend this to anyone looking for an enlightening and immersive experience that changes your viewpoint on several life aspects.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: I’ve been at Columbia University for a week, and am in my freshman year. I’m acclimating to the culture, getting information on clubs, organisations and courses and the students and teachers have been helpful and accommodating
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a Columbia University student, I am proud of myself and I feel very lucky. The school's name alone boasts prestige and prominence, as so many Nobel Prize winners, presidents, and successful businesspeople hail from the university. To be a part of this community, one that fosters community support as well as a push to strive for self improvement and global impact, has been incredibly motivating and exhilarating for me. I am very satisfied by the quality of my teachers and peers. The only things I would change are the tuition price and the humidity of NYC in the summer!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Excellent school with a lot of legacy and history in every corner of the school.  I will study engineering and the school has amazing resources.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: At Columbia University, my journey has been intellectually enriching and personally transformative. The rigorous academic environment has challenged me to think critically and engage deeply with my studies. I've had the privilege of learning from world-renowned professors who are passionate about their subjects and genuinely invested in their students' success. Beyond academics, Columbia’s vibrant community has been a highlight. From participating as the Co-Chair of the Columbia UNICEF Club to engaging in meaningful dialogues about global issues, I’ve found a diverse and supportive network of peers. The university's location in New York City has also provided unparalleled opportunities for internships, cultural experiences, and networking.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Attending Columbia is a truly life-changing experience, mainly due to the incredible diversity of people you encounter. The faculty is world-class, but I'd recommend that as an undergraduate, you steer a little clear of classes led by graduate students and focus on seminars with established, prolific professors which is where I've found the most value. I'd love to see Columbia emphasize and uplift the humanities just as it uplifts STEM, moving forward.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like how the faculties are willing to help. When I have financial difficulties, I contact our program office; the officer is very kind and helpful. The classes are great and useful for my future career.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia University is a great school that opens up opportunities for students. It is a vibrant learning community and  the diversity in people at the school only adds to that.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I’d describe Columbia University as a vibrant hub of knowledge nestled in the heart of New York City. The urban backdrop weaves itself into the university life, creating a unique mix of academia and real-world exposure. From challenging courses led by world-class faculty to a diverse array of student clubs and organizations, there’s no shortage of opportunities for intellectual growth and personal development.

My favorite aspect of Columbia is its deep commitment to academic rigor. Courses are challenging but rewarding, with professors who are not just experts in their fields, but also dedicated mentors. The university’s Core Curriculum stands out, offering a broad, well-rounded foundation in various disciplines, and instilling a valuable ability to approach problems from different angles.

The student body’s diversity is another strong point. With students from all corners of the globe, you’re exposed to a variety of perspectives and, cultures.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia is a great school on paper. It has every kind of program and a plethora of resources. Nearly everyone who attends this college should find a curriculum that leads to the career path of their choice. The worst part of the university is its conservative culture, lack of socio-economic diversity among students, and lack of classroom engagement by students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I truly benefit from the accessibility to professor's and student success tools. Although the curriculum requires a majority of independent self-teaching, the lectures serve as a supplemental buttress to learned topics. In addition; there is, an ARC (academic resource center), peer-student student groups, tutors, and extensive libraries.  I enjoy the prestige atmosphere and collegial  cooperation. Overall, I would recommend Columbia University to a friend.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia University in New York City offers an exceptional academic environment supported by esteemed faculty members and a comprehensive curriculum. The university's state-of-the-art facilities and resources provide students with the tools they need for research and innovation. The city's vibrant atmosphere and countless opportunities for internships and cultural immersion enhance the overall experience. Columbia fosters a diverse and inclusive community that encourages collaboration and personal growth. With its rich academic offerings and prime location, Columbia University is an excellent choice for those seeking a premier education and a vibrant college experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: It was an enriching experience that offered many hands on opportunities. The professors were extremely knowledgeable and passionate.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved the community and the events being hosted frequently. There was always an opportunity to make friends. Something I would like to see change is the prices of some of these events (lower), but overall I am great full to have gone and for my experience at Columbia Engineering!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is great, hard school and academics but there is a good community.  Being in New York City is one of the biggest pros of the school.  If you do not fit in or feel different, there is a whole city for you to find your community.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The campus is centered in Manhattan, a city where opportunities and networking is vast. As a pre-med student, there are so many medical related opportunities available which are at the highest of degree. Unfortunately, the college lacks school spirit in the sense that everyone is very independent. The city is practically everyone's backyard, therefore they do not need to be bottled on campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: So far I have loved my time at Columbia! The location is awesome, the community is great, and I feel like I've found a wonderful family at this school. There is so much history everywhere and the range of classes is really nice. There are plenty of clubs to join and ways to socialize with people. Academically, I don't find Columbia exceptionally difficult and I do think the Core requirements can be a bit annoying at times, but overall, it makes for a well rounded education that really forces you to branch out and explore new topics.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Professors are insightful and understanding. College faulty members are receptive and  approachable. Students are decisive, persuasive and intelligent.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia's campus is great! As a graduate student, I love seeing the level of diversity within the engineering department and the opportunity to get to learn about everyone's backgrounds! I do wish that classes were taught much better since it seems like professors are just rambling for 2.5 hours and wait for students to blow up Piazza over conceptual and hw questions. I do also wish there was a greater emphasis on publicizing campus activities to graduate students. All in all the student body is incredibly intelligent and hard working!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great school- so much to learn and experience in and out of the classroom. People from all over come here, and you will easily find someone to connect with.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience as a graduate student at Columbia University was incredibly fun. I enjoyed working with renowned faculty members and engaging in stimulating discussions with classmates. Outside of the classroom, I explored New York City and participated in campus activities, including joining a student organization related to my field of study. I loved the diversity of the student body and feel grateful for the opportunity to have studied at such a prestigious institution.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great university and campus. Professor are all great and the neighborhood is great too. Morningside heights just above central park and the subway station is located right next to the campus
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: It was excellent, but you had to be intentional about seeking out resources, opportunities, and communities.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: An experience that I will never forget. The education provided to me will help me promote change in my community.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Terrific school for academics and an amazing location in NYC. Objectively, pretty terrible undergrad experience (I came in as a transfer from another Ivy) - no school spirit, toxic overly competitive school culture prioritizing grades over learning/socialization, non-existent party scene. Alumni network is much weaker than peer schools, as hating Columbia is the most Columbia thing imaginable. However, the academics are top-notch, although you will likely struggle to maintain a good school-life balance. A lot of CU's flaws are common to all big city schools; as someone who previously studied on an isolated rural campus, those liberal arts schools will generally have a stronger student experience and alumni network compared to somewhere like Columbia, NYU, UCLA etc.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have had a great experience at Columbia. The students are very kind and welcoming and always willing to take the time out of their day to assist you or answer any questions about the university.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Excellent university! As a undergraduate, Columbia University has provided a plethora of resources and assistance to further my education!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Mailman is a great school of public health located in New York City. My only issues are with how traditional the program is. If you are someone who wants to understand the field of public health from a professional perspective, or if you are interested in biostats and epi, you will love the program here. The professors are very engaging and have a ton of experience in their fields.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: I wish the school were smaller, as their resources really are too few for such a large undergraduate student population. They treat their students as though we're part of their business, and it's very frustrating-- you can get lucky with some instructors, through, more often than not graduate students rather than professors.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Columbia. Though the work is challenging, I feel as though I am becoming a smarter person in more ways than one which makes it worth it. I also love that I am in NYC, and there are endless possibilities to have fun and destress with friends.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Having an Ivy League school on my resume defintely helps with getting more interviews for internships, especially during this recession. It opens the doors to new opportunities, especially for international students like me. The professors and TAs are super nice and supportive. There is lots of homework and self-reading involved so it might be hard to take on a part-time job during college. While it can be hard to make friends at first as you will be spending time in large halls most of the time, there are unlimited things to do in NYC.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The 24 hour library is the best! The food is good. I do feel unsafe as times as people can walk in at night when they want to. But, for the most part, there are always security guards walking around and one present by each of the entrance desks in each building.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Learned about Columbia University  in a college readiness summer internships. I learned Columbia  nurtures their student body, from Hispanics to African Americans, to ingress the traditions and values passed on from generation to generation. Providing the incentive for both the body and the student to grow collectively, as a community.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia University is a good private college with great financial aid opportunities for students and which operates on merit-based admission. The professors are outstanding, at the top of their personal fields of study, and very well connected within higher academic circles. Over half of the enrolled students receive some degree of financial aid, and they accept many first generation low income students. Campus is centralized, and decently separated from the rest of NYC, while still allowing students the opportunity to go out and explore what the city has to offer at their own discretion.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia is a great home for learning. However for non-traditional students, it can be a financial and social burden.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I think this is an amazing place to be. The university is huge and there’s a lot of opportunities to get involved. There’s so many people you are likely to find a nice group of friends. The fact that it is in NYC also make it an awesome place for going out, and finding job opportunities.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Columbia has amazing dining halls, and impressive libraries. The food is really so much better than other schools. I would not say that it always has appetizing food, but I like that there are always healthy eating options, which is essential for any college student to have a sustainable lifestyle. There's also the fact that it is in New York, so you get immersive experiences such as being able to visit the Met or other museums to see the pieces you  are studying in class. 

The return to campus after the pandemic was a bit hectic, as can be imagined, as the campus had to house more students than ever, leading to housing waitlists and singles being turned into doubles.

But overall, it provides an exciting college experience, where there is much to be learnt, including sometimes dealing with lack of accomodations.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I liked that there are endless academic opportunities available; you will never run out! Food is average and oftentimes the lines in the dining halls take an annoying amount of time. The dorms in my experience have been pretty nice, and some have crazy amazing views of the city. Students overall are pretty nice/polite here but there in definitely an air of competition in certain interest groups. Many of the general lectures courses leave a lot to be desired and didn't give me any special ivy league education that I couldn't have gotten elsewhere. However, that being said, I've also taken some incredible smaller courses where I've been able to build a relationship with my professor and learn a lot from them. Also make sure you are somewhat interested in what the core has to off because its a huge part of your education at Columbia.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: For those that are seeking an academic oasis in the middle of the best city on the planet, Columbia is definitely a perfect fit.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is a good school, but definitely an adjustment from high school. You need to do a lot of trial and error to figure out what works for you and what scenes you love most. But, overall a good experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The environment is highly conducive to learning. Professors are outstanding in their respective fields and are always open to helping students. Campus is gorgeous and the city provides an opportunity to explore as well.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's a very eye-opening environment, you're learning about all sorts of things from all sorts of people inside and outside of the classroom.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Currently a Junior at Columbia. I think that overall it's a good school and a relly good experience, especially for getting your education in the greatest city in the world. However, diversity (social and economic) remain a big problem here, and the differences in the Columbia experience is stark.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I definitely love Columbia for many aspects— the great professors, interesting classes, its location in New York City, the great friends that I have made, the food options— and much more. However, I do feel that there can be many improvements to my experience at Columbia. One of the difficulties that faces Columbia is how overcrowded shared spaces become. The dining halls, the libraries, and even the dorm hall bathrooms can be terrible experiences due to the high amount of students that consistently frequent these spots. Seeing long lines at the dining hall, not being able to find a seat at the library, and constantly dealing with dirty bathrooms given the number of students per bathroom in the dorm halls has a long-term impact on students after some time. In addition, it feels particularly difficult at times to make friends at Columbia. The orientation program at the beginning of the year does a poor job in building community, and there are not many opportunities to meet new people.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great School, Great professors. Students are hard-working, so it keeps you motivated.  Some of their withdrawal policies are a little unclear. If you are going to withdraw from an entire  semester start that process asap, or else u may end up with a whole bunch of ws
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like the diversity and the financial support they are willing to give students who need it and worry about how they will pay for their classes.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Columbia, not unlike other colleges but perhaps more so than other colleges, is what you make out of it because the environment is hyper-individualistic. The school, even advising deans, is unsupportive of its students and their issues. However, once you get used to this environment (not assimilated), you do become stronger. So in that sense, it prepares you for real life. Not the place, however, I would have wanted to spend my four years after high school. 

Regarding academics, the Core Curriculum is overrated mostly. Literature Humanities and Contemporary Civilization are certainly life-transforming classes (if you take them from rigorous professors) but the other classes are mostly viewed as banal requirements. Regarding safety, there is some sort of a crime going on every week around or in the vicinity of campus. A lot of pickpocketing on campus as well.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Literally such a dream to go here. The people I’ve met are so genuine and kind and curious and I’ve never felt more at home.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia’s bright and collaborative intellectual community makes it an exciting place to learn. All of the students are passionate and bring unique perspectives to our classes. Some of the dorms could use renovation, and the experience you have is definitely not the “traditional” college experience often depicted in media, but it is still incredibly special, especially being in New York City.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The professors and the quality of what I am learning is amazing. However, I think the department is underfunded, and research assistant opportunities for Master students are little to nonexistent, everything is reserved for PHD candidates.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia University is a beautiful campus with a lot of well rounded individuals who have a desire for success. All though the degree is one of the best, the school itself has a lot of flaws. Housing is not the best compared to other universities, the dining hall worker can be very aggressive and rude at times. And as many can agree, stress levels are at a all time high and I don’t necessarily feel like I’m getting great college experience compared to what I see around the nation.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's an awesome place to be, there are many great people, plenty of opportunities to explore and develop interests
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: i have always sought universities that have wide range of diversity . once my friend told about this uni and its students coming from all over the world , i very liked it
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I absolutely love the campus! The environment is super amazing; everyone is super friendly and comes from all backgrounds. Academics with school and all are manageable, but just place hard work and you'll do great!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The school is beautiful and the location is unforgettably unique. However, the education should not be exalted in the way it is. This school is really not worth an almost six-figure tuition. The professors for core classes don't seem to care about the students much, especially in SEAS (the engineering school). STEM classes are very much "figure it out yourself" versus a hands-on, collaborative, and educational experience. The culture is extremely competitive and if you're looking for a traditional, American college experience with FUN, don't come here. I wanted to give the "Party Scene" rating a 2 for the on-campus functions, however, Columbia saves itself via its prime location in Manhattan. There's always a party somewhere on this island. That is the one saving grace I'll give this school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: This school is fantastic! The classes are all fascinating and all of the other students I have met have been very interesting and kind. There is a vibe of community rather than competition. The work is definitely hard, and as a middle income student, it is sometimes difficult being exposed to other kids who have so much privilege, but overall it is a great place to be. Highly recommend!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia delivers on it's high standard and reputation for academics, but more often than not, students feel socially isolated for much of their undergraduate experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like being in the city, and I think the students are great. I am a sophomore at Columbia, and for the semester and a half that I have been on campus, I have enjoyed my experience. However, Columbia did not handle the pandemic very well. Moreover, this is clearly a for-profit institution, and much of the administration would rather line their pockets than make important changes.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I think that the experience of the school was amazing and maybe to some not so much but during my time here i have loved it i would totally recommend to people who are looking for colleges.  The people here were so nice and considerate, and i have made many many new friends.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Amazing experience, loved the professors who were all very nice. Found a great similarly passionate community.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Attending Columbia university has been a dream that manifested itself into my life. I can't be happier with this choice I made. From academics, to professors, to student life, Columbia has truly been my second home.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I had an awesome experience at Columbia University. The instruction is a great mix of excellent STEM programs and reputable arts programs. Being a graduate student I have found that the academic clique is well organized. The academic standard is set prestigious enough to constantly motivate people and exercise any level of thoughts and discourse. And the location of the school can't be beat, there is nothing like living in New York City. There are practically endless opportunities for work and studies. Above all it is a very diverse environment with reach international wisdom.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: So far I have only experienced trauma. The administration is nothing but a cement wall.  They do not answer in time and forced me to a deadline.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Columbia is the best possible school and I love it here. 
The administration has provided all resources that I have ever asked for.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia has been a wonderful experience, and even with the pandemic, you really feel like the Professors want the beset for you. There are so many staff members here, that if you need support in anything, there's almost definitely someone around who can and wants to help you.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia University is a really great school and I'm glad that I have the opportunity to attend. The location is also a huge perk, but there is also a significant stress culture that can sometimes be overwhelming. Also the food is not that good
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Not great food or dining, but everything else is amazing including academics, professors, and living in NYC.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a Columbia College STEM major (BA 2018), I found the rigorous core curriculum particularly challenging, and wonderful! Were it not for those courses, I wouldn't have developed the writing and thinking skills I have today. I loved spending my college years in the city. The campus is amazing -- it's an integrated, relatively close-knit campus life that you don't always find at urban schools.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: What I like about Columbia University is the culture of curiosity. Everyone here at the school seems so interested in something, whether thats politics, science, literature, or journalism. Everyone has a passion and is so interested in the passion of others, it is honestly pretty inspiring. At Columbia you feel motivated to find your passion and do well because everyone else is so passionate that you can't help but feel swept along. I also find the resources here at the university to be so plentiful, no matter what you're interested in there are people who are here who study it and can help you, you just need to find them.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia is a special experience with numerous opportunities to build a community with other students. And Columbia is happy and great school. Love the diveristy! High quality and delicious dining food!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I enjoyed taking the humanities classes there; however, STEM classes tended to be huge lecture hall-based classes that were difficult to get in and tended to just be a professor reading off a PowerPoint slide. In terms of food, they tout having a huge range of vegetarian and vegan options but often offer pasta and steamed vegetables. Sometimes they have great options, but it is just a once-in-a-blue-moon occasion. Recently, the dining halls have added new stations and options which seems promising. I feel that I could've gotten a better quality education at a smaller local university. However, the people I've met and the few golden professors I met made it all worth it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: It was a great experience because I enjoyed the fact that I was in new york city and studying in Columbia university provide a big network
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia is an exceptional University because it embraces a diverse student body. As part of the cohort, I've evolved in many aspects of my academic and personal life. The classes are rigorous, requiring me to be fully dedicated and exercise time management. Therefore, I have time to be part of club sports such as equestrian and karate. Columbia is not just an institution of education; it is also a place where pupils are shaped to become well-rounded individuals who contribute to the development of humanity.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
great academic experience and good food
you can play with a lot of peers in the new
 york
you can always find interesting things to do.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: It took me two years to get accepted but I only wanted to go there after graduating from a big ten midwestern University and  turning down a full scholarship there. The education and experience I got was worth the risk and BTW they gave me a full scholarship too. Lucky I guess
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Attending Columbia University was a fantastic experience for me.  My professors were all very interesting.  Some were a bit quirky, but that was ok.  They always challenged me to be open to possibilities and to figure things out from all angles.  The work load was definitely heavy, but I learned more there than anywhere else I have been since then.  And the facilities were excellent.  There's a telescope on campus and I'll never forget our class meeting at 9pm one night to view the planets and see what astronomers actually did.  We saw rings of Saturn, Jupiters moons, storms on Jupiter, star clusters, and more.  Even though it was only an elective class, I found it fascinating and the professor, who was visiting from England, was very engaging and enjoyed his work.  All of my instructors were.  They were all working and teaching, so it was the best of both worlds.  Also, the research materials were endless.  It didn't hurt that the school is in Manhattan, and in my favorite part!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have enjoyed my time at Columbia, although it has been hard to find a balance between social life, academics, and extracurriculars.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great experience but it’s so expensive honesty if you have to pay yourself go elsewhere but if you can afford I recommend
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I was looking for a good school for becoming a author and this is school was the best rated. So I would highly recommend going here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: What I love about Columbia University is that they care. Yes - students may say they only want money, etc. but not the professors, not the deans. My professors have bent over backward to help me to the best of their abilities. My dean taught me the importance of my mental health and to prioritize that over school. Although my goal was to graduate undergraduate school as early as possible, my dean helped me realize how much more easy it is after getting professional help for my mental health. I'm very grateful for my dean and my professors. Truly I am.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Loving the experience so far. Everyone has been very friendly, helpful, and quick to communicate. I've had all my questions and concerns answered and have been assisted in every step of the process. Can't wait for campus to reopen.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia has excellent professors in fascinating fields. Students are all brilliant are very engaged so classrooms always feel engaged and worth the effort. The campus is beautiful and being in New York City is incredible.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia is a very good school. However, they are known to have a racial bias against Asians like many elite schools do and also they discriminate against Veterans. One Asian-American veteran student described his on campus experience as being more traumatic and PTSD-inducing than his Navy Seal combat tours.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Works Here

Overall%20Experience.Review: I absolutely loved the Core Curriculum and the way several of my classes integrated the unique opportunities and cultural resources in New York into my instruction.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia University upholds a prestige in academia that is quite unparalleled. Because of this prestige, Columbia students have a wealth of access to jobs and opportunities. However, the price of Columbia really weighs heavy on the shoulders of Columbia students and their minimal efforts to lower tuition at large, especially for low-income students is quite disappointing.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: A lot of resources and a very diverse group of students and faculty. I feel motivated to learn from people from different backgrounds!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Professors are really awesome and give their all to help students. There is always something to do on campus. If you are a freshman I would recommend taking an array of classes and then decide what major you want to pursue.  Don't overwhelm yourself with the classes you take and most importantly don't compare yourself to your classmates. Everyone's circumstances are  different. There is a lot of academic help and tutoring available on  campus, don't think that you are the only one not understanding the topic.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I REALLY enjoyed talking to some of the athletic coaches at Columbia. They were kind and very helpful.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Columbia. It’s really the students who make the experience. I’ve met some of the most intelligent, high achieving, self motivated individuals. It’s creates an aspiring ambience on campus which influences you to work harder and aim higher. Someone is always willing to help you out, whether it’s with academics/networking. Columbia has a great community. However, I do wish that facilities were more updated...especially the engineering facilities. I also wish that the curriculums would be more up to date with a bit of emphasis on applications (most courses tend to be theoretical).
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia has offered me an intellectually challenging, academically rigorous environment surrounded my professors who are enthusiastic about their subjects and sincerely invested in their students success.  I transferred in from a peer institution of equal 'academic prestige,' however the difference between the two is notable and I regret not coming to Columbia sooner.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Students are all kind and friendly! Teaching could be improved somewhat, but I have definitely had some incredible professors at the University!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia is great for those who are ready to seize any opportunities presented to them. Despite this, it's easy to feel like just another number as the university is made up of many different colleges and has tens of thousands of students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Columbia University is located at the heart of Manhattan in NYC, on the Morningside Heights neighbordhood. 

Academics can be a toin coss, as you can get professors who don't teach very well and you spend your study time teaching the content to yourself. On the other hand, some professors really care about their students and go beyond to ensure their success.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I really like the events hosted by University Life.  I am learning so much from faculty and I am really thankful to them for where I am now in terms of my educational experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia has an incredible student body and no shortage of opportunities to take advantage of.  The social culture can be difficult to handle at time and very stressful.  Courses are difficult and not all professors are the best, but the TA program is very strong and many professors do care deeply about the students and their experience.  Columbia has many resources and makes it easy to find opportunities in the city and for the summer.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have toured this university two times and I am so surprised to see the faculty and the facility, revealing a different aspect of New York.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: professors can be a hit or miss, the hits are truly amazing and can make your overall experience worthwhile
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Wow, I loved it there! The academics were top notch, and several of my peers are already successful in their careers; the degree as a label has traction in the job market.

As a Veteran who grew up in Minnesota, the weather was mild for me, but those from the South will find the winter challenging.

I found myself very absorbed by my studies at that time, and so did most of the other students. That can make it extremely easy to meet people in an intellectual sense but somewhat difficult to meet in a social sense. My advice is if you want to date, you should learn how to meet people at NYU.

Financial aid is difficult to obtain, but I was a Veteran, and the government paid my tuition, so that was not my struggle.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: it's dog-eat-dog. Many of the students offer performative support to others, which matches their performative activism. It's a lot, but not in a good way.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: It was really great. I could not have had a better experience in this place. It is practically the best college I have ever been to.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Columbia with all my heart. The professors are very engaged, the campus is its own little island in a highly diverse city full of opportunities, and the student body is brilliant. The culture is very competitive and academic, but that is to be expected, and that is ultimately what motivates me.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia is known for being at "the heart of NYC," but what I find more attractive about it is the beauty of the campus itself and the rigorous academics.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am grateful for my time at Columbia because I learned a lot in the class. I learned how to think and question the world around me. Most students enjoy having philosophical conversations about the texts we are all required to read. Even though it can be a bit pretentious sometimes, it is really cool how eager people are to learn, and the passion they have for the new ideas they have learned. That being said, a lot of people are obnoxious about their intelligence. Students are pretty also pretty obnoxious when it comes to being super PC.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia is a wonderful school. Beautiful campus on New York's Upper West Side. Really helpful advisement staff and the classes, classmates, and teachers are amazing.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia University offers many programs that will help further your academic goals. The University is well renown for their business program and engineering programs. If an individual is interested in the Humanities, this is the place for you. There are first class professors that are experts in their field.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Life-changing experience. I absolutely loved my professors and friends. The time I spent here was absolutely incredible.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia was a great experience I hope others could enjoy. campus I. lovely and the food is amazing but the professors were the best part
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Attending Columbia was the best decision I've ever made. Not only are you at a world class institution in the greatest city in the world, you are surrounded by extremely intelligent and hardworking classmates who will inspire you and push you to become the best version of yourself. The opportunities at your fingertips -- both on and off campus -- are limitless. It is not an easy school by any means, but put in the hard work and you will be rewarded in so many ways.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Columbia University has its title of IVY League school for a reason. The strongest aspects of the school are academia, research, and professors.
